item.title: 14. A Life-Cycle Guide to Investing
item.description: 5 Asset Allocation Principles History shows that higher risk bears high reward From 1926 to 2017: Average Annual Return Year-to-Year Volatility of Returns Small-company stocks 12.1% 31.7% Large-company stocks 10.2% 19.8% Long-term government bonds 5.5% 9.9% US Treasury Bills 3.4% 3.1% The risk of investing in stocks and bonds depends on the hold duration From 1950 to 2017, the S&P averaged 10% per year.
